name: beadily
content:
Add to word list

with beady eyes (= small, bright eyes like those of a bird), or very closely: She regarded him beadily in a way that suggested she knew he wasn't telling the truth. With her new book, the author beadily scrutinizes the artists, gallery owners, and patrons who make up the New York art world.
More examplesFewer examplesThe substitute teacher could sense the students eying her beadily, wondering what kind of personality they were dealing with.I can sense my cat looking at me beadily whenever I walk toward the cabinet where I keep his food.
